name: Comfort Inn Yosemite Valley Gateway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here earlier this month while visiting Sequoia Park. We did not stay in the main hotel because I had payed a few dollars more for a suite. The suites are located in 2 buildings near the hotel. I am sorry I spent the extra money. The furniture and rugs in our rooms were in terrible condition and need to be replaced. We did find amusing, however, the 3 pictures in the living area. All 3 were identical but 1 had been turned upside down to give the appearance that it is different. If you are considering staying at this hotel do not pay extra for the suites. At least not unless the suites have been refurbished.
reviews.title: Once was Enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mariposa is located about 1/2 hour/45 min from the west entrance to Yosemite. We choose this as our place to stay after leaving the park from a long day of hiking. The hotel was what we expected and a good value for the price. The room was comfortable. Bed was average, TV was old, heater unit was nice, bathroom was ok (hot water was slow), but overall clean and fine. The breakfast in the morning was not too bad, waffles and other continental style stuff. Only downside to the hotel was that I was awaken in the night by some local teens that were bumping their music on the street.
reviews.title: Got what we expected

reviews.text: The Comfort Inn Mariposa is a 2 star with decent value. We got what we paid for and were satisfied.
reviews.title: Nice and convenient

reviews.text: We might stay here again if in the same circumstances.
reviews.title: Terrible

likes.disliked: — non professional behaviour of Manager/owner of property

reviews.title: Noisy pipes!
reviews.text: I just stayed at the Comfort Inn in Mariposa after visiting Yosemite National Park and was quite pleased with the hotel. We arrived late after driving from Yosemite and decided to look around for a hotel. I had previously read the reviews here and looked at pricing on websites and decided not to book any room in advance without seeing it first. I was quite pleased with the hotel and the front desk staff was very helpful. They told us up front about the various rates available and we took advantage of the AAA rate savings. They also directed us to the various food choices in town which was helpful at the late hour. The room was comfortable, spacious and clean. The HVAC worked well and kept us comfortable through the night. The bathroom was large and clean although it was a big plain and the toilet was noisy when flushed. The TV worked fine and had a variety of stations to choose from. The beds were firm but comfortable and the linens and furniture were in good condition. The only drawback I can see is there are no elevators and you may have to climb either one or two flights of stairs to your room. The hotel is on the western outskirts of town and up on a hill so it was also a little hard to locate after dark. There are other options available but we did not check around to compare rates or rooms as this was perfectly fine and the rate was reasonable for the location. None of the hotels in the area are high-end and apparently only one hotel has elevators so if this is an issue you should check first, otherwise I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for one night to visit Yosemite the next morning. While our room was clean, it was also quite small (there was barely enough space to open both our suitcases on the floor). Pool was okay, as was the breakfast (nice waffles). Adequate for an overnight stay.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: My wife and I spent the first couple of days of a week long visit to Yosemite National Park at this property. As noted by some other posters, the park is a good 45 minute drive or so from Mariposa. However we are early risers and found the drive to be quite pleasant and scenic, and we were able to beat the long waits at the new bridge construction. Contrary to what was said in another post, there are in fact a number of restuarants in town. We ate one night at a local burger joint that had a lot of character (walls and ceiling wallpapered with old record album covers) and found a very nice, if small, Mexican restaurant just a block or so from the hotel. The hotel was okay as a base of operations for exploring Yosemite. The breakfast was pretty much standard. It would have been a plus if there was a fridge and microwave in the room, something I have come to pretty much expect when staying at this chain. Mariposa itself is a quaint little town with old west flavor that I wish we had more time to explore. All in all, a pretty good stay.
reviews.title: Worked Fine for Our Purposes

likes.liked: — Good rate/value in relation to location
likes.disliked: — No fridge or microwave in standard room

reviews.text: Very good quality for the price with convenient access to Yosemite.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times a year for the last several years. An honest opinion from a regular is that this hotel is badly in need of renovation. We also had an item stolen by housekeeping which they denied but none the less it was removed from our room. The exterior is or appears nicely maintained but the rooms have not. I would give this hotel a 1 star in AAA terms. The place is ok as far as clean but nothing has changed in the rooms in several years. The place is just worn out.
reviews.title: Worn Out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Side notes-
reviews.title: Bad Experience

reviews.text: Hotels close to Yosemite seem a little few & far between. As a result, the prices seem to be a little escalated. This wasn't the cheapest hotel in my two week trek around the State but it was a decent clean and comfortable hotel so I can't complain much.
reviews.title: Huuuuuge bed! Quiet location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly reception staff. On requesting a suitable dining location they recommend local restaurant with voucher for free glass of wine or dessert. I didn't take up this recommendation as I wasn't taken with the menu but there was a yummy pizzeria just a short walk away.
reviews.title: Decent

reviews.text: I had a room with a queen size bed which was HUGE! Very comfortable and clean room and bathroom. Breakfast in the morning was busy and in a small area with limited seating. Could do with a bit more room.
reviews.title: It's a Comfort Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large car park. Swimming pool looked nice (but didn't use it).
reviews.title: Okay for a one night stay
Stayed in a converted "house"
reviews.text: The hotel is about 45 minutes from Yosemite Valley and maybe a half hour from the south entrance to Yosemite. The town is small but quite nice. Typical Comfort Inn. The room was nothing special but it was clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly. Free breakfast was decent; waffles were pretty good. Only negative was a very low shower head. Would stay there again.
Stayed att Mariposa on our yourney to Yosemite. The motel is clean and comfortobel but for the price it should be a little better. Everthing was ok, but nothing mutch better than that.
reviews.title: Could be better for the price

reviews.text: We stayed here overnight on the way to Yosemite. The rooms were clean & nice. The outdoor pool was a great way to end a long day of traveling. The continental breakfast was sufficient & included a waffle maker. The only thing we did not like was hiking up 3-floors to our room. If you stay here, request a room on the lower floor. Aside from that, we loved the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel close to Yosemite

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Comfort Inn in Mariposa to go to Yosemite. We had a fairly comfortable room, though it was getting a bit faded. The bathtub needed resurfacing having peeled off most of the coat and in my brother's room, the tub took a long while to drain. The air conditioner in my room quit on the second night and we knew about it only after we had gotten back from a day at Yosemite and of course it was too late to do anything. We managed to get through the night which a not too warm. Another week and it might have been hell. The management gave us a discount for the non functioning air conditioner. The rooms were clean and comfortable otherwise and the location was good, close to restaurants. It is the main staging point for accessing Yosemite. The breakfast was decent and the service was good too.
reviews.title: Mostly comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is 90 minutes from Yosemite Valley in Mariposa. It’s set back from the main street thus the street noise was minimal. Staffs were very friendly and efficient. It’s a comfortable place and a typical Comfort Inn. The king size bed sank in on one side and it was easily roll the edge of the bed. The AC is sufficient and loud, the typical motel style unit with heat and AC combination under the window. The bathroom was renovated and clean. It has the new style curve out curtain rod. Continental breakfast was included. It was simple with bread, cereal, and make our own waffle. There is a computer with internet access free for guest to use in the breakfast room. There is also free wifi and we had good signal in the room. Other buildings have weaker signal and the front desk could tell you if you would have good signal or not in your room.
reviews.title: Comfortable place to stay
Nice, clean place to spend a night!
reviews.text: This seems to be a popular place with visitors to Yosemite national park, particularly since accommodation inside the park is so hard to get. It's a good one hour drive from the valley along Merced river on Rte. 140. Rooms are well maintained, free wireless internet inside the room, decent breakfast to get an early start on the next day....

aka: Comfort Inn Yosemite Valley Gateway Hotel
description: Visiting Yosemite National Park? Stay on a quiet mountainside above California's historic gold mining town of Mariposa, 32 miles West of Yosemite. Wake up to a deluxe hot breakfast buffet, swim in the seasonal pool and spa, and enjoy free WiFi in all guest rooms. Walk to nearby restaurants, gift shops, wine tasting, brew pubs and art galleries. Open all year, Comfort Inn Yosemite Valley Gateway offers reasonable rates and convenience, clean rooms and suites with full kitchens.
